business.headline: Arkade Developers IPO allotment: Check status, GMP, subscription Arkade Developers IPO allotment: Investors can check their allotment status by logging into the BSE website or the Bigshare Services Pvt Ltd website, the issue's registrar.
Northern Arc Capital IPO allotment tomorrow: Check latest subscription, GMPNorthern Arc Capital Limited, founded in 2009, provides retail loans to underserved households and businesses across India.

Sensex, Nifty end higher after US Fed's 50 bps rate cut; NTPC gainsThe S&P BSE Sensex ended 236.57 points higher at 83,184.80, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 38.25 points higher at 25,415.80. Both the indices had hit fresh all-time highs in early trade.
Government working on new income tax act. Check inside detailsThe new tax framework aims to replace the current 1961 act, simplifying the tax process for individuals and businesses.

RPSG's Firstsource expands globally, eyes $550 million boost from AIThe expansion is part of Firstsource's strategy to improve its business margins while continuing to create jobs in India. For every position created in Australia, the company plans to create three jobs in India.

Gold prices react to US Fed rate cut: What investors need to knowThe US Federal Reserve's rate cuts aim to stabilise the economy but raise concerns about their impact on global markets, particularly on gold prices, a key investment in uncertain times.

Explained: Why small and midcap stocks are under pressure todayPublic Sector Undertaking (PSU) stocks, particularly in sectors such as defence, railways, and non-banking financial companies (NBFCs), have been hit hard.
IT, banking, large-cap stocks: Strategies to boost portfolio after Fed rate cutWill the US Fed's rate cut boost opportunities on Dalal Street? Check these expert strategies to realign your portfolio.

HAL, IRFC, BHEL stocks fall: Here's why PSU stocks are under pressurePSU stocks fell even as India's benchmark indices, Sensex and Nifty, rose on the back of higher-than-expected interest rate cuts by the US Federal Reserve.

Explained: What US Fed's 50 bps rate cut means for Indian economyThe Fed's decision signalled a shift towards easing monetary policy, with experts divided on its implications for the global economy, including India. Here's a detailed look at how the bigger-than-expected rate cut could impact the Indian economy and the broader market.
Cisco cuts thousands of jobs in second biggest layoff of 2024: Report This latest round of layoffs follows a previous cut in February when Cisco let go of about 4,000 employees.

US Fed cuts rates by 50 bps: How will it affect Indian stock market?This is the first time the Fed has reduced rates since 2020, and it has been done to address slowing economic growth and easing inflation in the US.

Sensex jumps over 700 points, Nifty crosses 25,500 for 1st time; IT stocks gainThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 758.7 points at 83,706.93 at 9:41 am, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 215.40 points to trade at 25,592.95.

US Fed slashes rates by 50 bps in first rate reduction since 2020Policymakers see the Fed's benchmark rate falling by another half of a percentage point by the end of this year, another full percentage point in 2025, and by a final half of a percentage point in 2026 to end in a 2.75 per cent-3.00 per cent range.
US Fed rate decision today at 11:30 pm – 5 things to watch outMarkets are widely expecting a 25-basis-point cut in the key interest rate, marking the first reduction in four years.

Tupperware, once a household name, files for bankruptcyTupperware Brands and some of its subsidiaries filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection on Tuesday. The company, widely known for its food storage containers, has been struggling with falling sales in recent years.

NPS Vatsalya: How to invest, eligibility criteria, and online buying guideNPS Vatsalya enables parents or guardians to open a pension account for minors and contribute as little as Rs 1,000 annually, making it accessible to families from various economic backgrounds.

Explained: Why IT stocks faced profit booking ahead of US Fed rate decisionMphasiS led the decline, dropping 5.6%, followed by L&T Technology Services, Persistent Systems, Tata Consultancy Services, HCL Technologies, and Tech Mahindra, which saw losses ranging from 3% to 4%.
Sensex, Nifty fall amid profit booking in IT stocks; TCS falls 4%The S&P BSE Sensex closed 131.43 points down at 82,948.23, whille the NSE Nifty50 lost 41 points to end at 25,377.55.

Reliance Infra shares hit 20% upper circuit. What's next? The sharp uptick in Reliance Infra's share price followed the company's announcement of a significant reduction in its standalone external debt, from Rs 3,831 crore to Rs 475 crore.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Israel destroys 1,000 Hezbollah rocket launcher barrels, Middle East on boilThe Israeli Defence Force (IDF) stated that the fighter jets struck 100 rocket launchers consisting of around 1,000 barrels that were about to be used to immediately fire towards Israeli territory.

Kolkata doctors call off protest, to resume essential services from SaturdayJunior doctors protesting against the rape and murder of the trainee doctor will resume essential services from September 21.

Change in ghee brand behind Tirupati temple laddoo controversy?Chandrababu Naidu's claim, citing a lab report, that animal fat was found in the ghee procured during the YSR Congress Party regime has brought into focus the halt in the supply of the famous Nandini ghee last year.

Insaniyat dead, Jamhooriyat in ICU and Kashmiriyat buried as J&K goes for pollsIt is against a backdrop of colliding images that the Kashmir Valley is voting in an Assembly election for the first time in a decade.

Is it a good idea to have breakfast for dinner?Having breakfast for dinner can be an easy way to ensure nutritious food intake and avoid consuming junk or outside food, even with a busy work schedule. But there are a few things to keep in mind.

Biker dies after collision with SUV in Gurugram, deadly crash caught on cameraA biker, Akshat Garg, died after being hit by a Mahindra 3XO driving on the wrong side in Gurugram's DLF Phase II. Police have filed an FIR, and investigations are ongoing.

Moulded in TNPL, aggressive R Ashwin does a Rishabh Pant in Chennai TestIndia vs Bangladesh, 1st Test: Having worked on improving his range of big shots in the Tamil Nadu Premier League earlier this year, R Ashwin flaunted his aggressive avatar, hitting his fastest Test hundred. Ashwin and Ravindra Jadeja rescued India from 144 for 6 with a counter-attacking 195-run stand in Chennai on Thursday, September 19.

Speculative, misleading: India on report of diversion of ammunition to UkraineThe Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) has rejected the claims made by news agency Reuters that artillery shells sold by Indian arms makers were diverted by European customers to Ukraine.

How pager blasts, Hamas chief killing have brought Middle East to brink of warIsrael-Hezbollah War: Even though the intensity of the hostilities has waxed and waned, there is no sign of a pause in the year-long war in Gaza. The pager blasts in Lebanon have further pushed the Middle East to the brink of a full-blown regional war.

EY India Chairman denies work pressure as reason for employee's death: ReportThe death of a 26-year-old Ernst & Young employee, Anna Sebastian Perayil, has sparked outrage after her mother's emotional letter went viral, raising concerns over work pressure within the company.

5 Odisha cops suspended for alleged assault on Army officer, his fiancéeAn Indian Army officer and his fiancé The incident came to light when an army officer and his fiancée were allegedly assaulted at Bharatpur Police Station after attempting to report a road rage incident. The couple claimed that they were harassed by some people while driving.

Offensive against Hezbollah: 5 big goals Israel scored with pager blastsIsrael has launched an offensive against Hezbollah in Lebanon. As thousands of pagers and electronic devices exploded across Lebanon in two days, experts suggested that Israel's ultimate aim through these detonations was much bigger than just targeting Hezbollah foot soldiers. These are the five big goals that Israel scored.

Video: Armed robbers attack man inside shop in Punjab, flee with cash, mobileAt least four to five armed robbers entered a medical shop and attacked a man with sticks and sharp-edged weapons in Punjab's Moga district before fleeing away with cash and a mobile phone.

Tirupati laddoos contain beef fat, fish oil, confirms lab reportA report by a private laboratory has revealed that the samples of the ghee used in making Tirupati laddoos contained foreign fat, including palm oil, fish oil, beef tallow and lard (obtained by rendering the fatty tissue of a pig).

2 Israeli soldiers killed near Lebanon border after strikes launched over BeirutIsrael-Hezbollah War live updates: Deafening sonic booms from Israeli warplanes were witnessed in Lebanon's Beirut days after pager explosions, and subsequent walkie-talkie explosions targeting armed militant group Hezbollah claimed lives. 

The development came not so long after Hezbollah chief Hassan Nasrallah denounced the pager explosions and blamed Israel for it. Nasrallah also said Israel violated "red lines" and the move could be a "declaration of war". 

The Israel Defence Forces in a tweet said they were striking Hezbollah targets in Lebanon to degrade Hezbollah's terrorist capabilities and infrastructure.

Donald Trump's call to revoke ABC licence over September 10 debate rejectedThe Republican presidential candidate had demanded that ABC should lose its broadcast licences over the network's moderating during his September 10 presidential debate with Democrat Kamala Harris.

West Bengal issues directions to ensure safety of healthcare staff in stateAs per the directions, adequate availability of On Duty Rooms, washrooms, CCTVs, drinking water facilities at various healthcare facilities should be ensured at the earliest.
I hate you (like I love you), Emily in ParisEmily Cooper's French visa is not expiring anytime soon. She is going to be on Netflix, and in our lives, for a long time.

Delhi-NCR to witness rain till early October due to delayed monsoon withdrawalThis forecast comes as the national capital exceeded both its annual and seasonal average rainfall in early September, with total rainfall crossing the 1,000 mm mark.

War of words over waqf bill as Parliament committee faces deadlineAccording to sources, several rounds of clashes erupted among members over the role of the Collector, the presence of a non-Muslim member on the board, and the statute of limitations on Waqf properties.

Anil Kapoor's The Night Manager nominated for 2024 International Emmy AwardsThe Night Manager, starring Aditya Roy Kapur, Anil Kapoor and Sobhita Dhulipala, has been nominated for the Best Drama Series in the 2024 International Emmy Awards.

Food delivery agent ends life, blames customer for scolding him for order delayA 19-year-old food delivery executive died by suicide after being scolded by a customer for a delayed delivery in Chennai.

Delhi water supply to be hit today, check list of affected areasWater supply will be affected in Civil Lines, Hindu Rao Hospital, Kamla Nagar, Shakti Nagar, Karol Bagh, Pahar Ganj, Inderpuri and several other parts of Delhi.

BJP, Congress manifestos for Haryana polls target women, youth, farmersInterestingly, both political parties have made promises which are similar to each other. The BJP has made 20 election promises, of which five are similar to those made by the Congress.

Nayanthara, Vignesh Shivan and twin sons head to Mykonos for holidayNayanthara, Vignesh Shivan and their twin sons, Uyir and Ulagam, have jetted off to Greece for a holiday. The filmmaker gave a glimpse of their stay at the Mykonos Island.

Black Mirror Season 7 cast announced: Emma Corrin, Paul Giamatti, and othersBlack Mirror Season 7's cast was announced on September 19 in a video. The new season, featuring actors like Awkwafina and Paul Giamatti, will stream six episodes in 2025.

Newlyweds Aditi Rao Hydari and Siddharth walk hand-in-hand at Mumbai airportAditi Rao Hydari and Siddharth were seen at Mumbai airport, making their first appearance as a married couple. They shared their wedding photos on Instagram on September 16.

sports.headline: Harry Brook's bizarre take on 1st ODI loss vs Australia: 'We want to entertain'England's young ODI skipper Harry Brook gave a bizarre statement following his team's seven-wicket loss against Australia in the first ODI of the five match series in Nottingham.

Champions League: Barcelona stunned by AS Monaco, Arsenal held by Atalanta10-man Barcelona were beaten 2-1 by AS Monaco while Arsenal had David Raya to thank as they salvaged a point against Atalanta on Thursday, September 19. Atletico Madrid and Bayer Leverkusen started their campaigns with wins.

KL Rahul's temperamental problem has plagued his career: Sanjay ManjrekarFormer India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar has blamed KL Rahul's temperamental issues for his low returns in Test cricket. Rahul was dismissed for just 16 (52) on Day 1 against Bangladesh.

Yashasvi hit a fifty when the rest of the top-order failed in tricky conditions.

Go hard like Rishabh: R Ashwin reveals mantra behind Chennai Test hundredRavichandran Ashwin revealed that he adopted Rishabh Pant's aggressive batting style to score a crucial century, partnering with Ravindra Jadeja to rescue India after a top-order collapse on Day 1 of the Chennai Test against Bangladesh, taking India to 339/6.
R Ashwin emulates Tendulkar with back-to-back hundreds at ChepaukIND vs BAN: R Ashwin racked up his second Test hundred at the Chepauk and continued his love affair with the iconic venue in Chennai.

KL Rahul's dismissal after getting set was disappointing: Zaheer KhanKL Rahul's dismissal after getting set at the crease in India's first Test against Bangladesh disappointed former pacer Zaheer Khan, who stressed Rahul missed a crucial opportunity to stabilize India's innings following an early top-order collapse.

On a strange Chennai day, Ashwin and Jadeja lead a familiar rescue actIndia vs Bangladesh, 1st Test: R Ashwin and Ravindra Jadeja led a familiar rescue act for India, stitching an unbeaten 195-run partnership on Thursday. Bangladesh dominated the first half of a strangely overcast day in Chennai, but Inida fought back to take control.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
